data.title: Former Toledo mayors address handling of recent violence
meta_keywords: Local government in the United States
data.meta_description: With crime numbers continuing to rise in the City of Toledo, two former mayors, Michael Bell and Donna Owens, are using their platform to speak out. They did just that today at Savage Park, the site of a shooting no less than a month ago. "When you're shooting 23 shots in this park, that's out of control, when it's a family affair," Owens said.
data.text:
With crime numbers continuing to rise in the City of Toledo, two former mayors, Michael Bell and Donna Owens, are using their platform to speak out.

They did just that today at Savage Park, .

"When you're shooting 23 shots in this park, that's out of control, when it's a family affair," Owens said.

The two spoke on the effect the crime rate has on the city in multiple ways, stating that you don't have to reinvent the wheel when it comes to the public safety, but take the lead of other cities that are doing it right.

Michael Bell, Former Mayor of Toledo:

"If you can't get the crime rate down, you can't have economic development. It's impossible to do because people will not come to your city, they will leave your city," Bell explained. "It is so important to be able to really jump aggressively on that crime issue, be able to tie it with social programs."

Owens focused in on the aspect of children growing up in the area, only knowing violence, and with that being the case, the city's future is at risk.

Donna Owens, Former Mayor of Toledo:

"If we don't change the people that are growing up to be positive, influential, caring, loving, then we're lost as a country," Owens said.

Owens also called out current Toledo Mayor Wade Kapszukiewicz on using $613,000 to revamp city park signs, saying that the priorities are all wrong.

"What would that $613,000 do to improve the lives of children in this community and their families? The priorities are wrong."

We reached out to the Kapszukiewicz campaign for a response to Owens comments but did not hear back.
